namespace.name: blackberry.invoke
namespace.comment: The Invoke object contains methods that interact with other applications on a BlackBerry smartphone.
namespace.details: The invoke() method on the invoke object allows you to pass arguments to the target application. The types of arguments can be one of: AddressBookArguments, CalendarArguments, MapsArguments, MemoArguments, MessageArguments, PhoneArguments, SearchArguments, TaskArguments, CameraArguments, BrowserArguments, and JavaArguments.
namespace.example:
<script type="text/javascript">  

      var contact = new blackberry.pim.Contact();
          contact.firstName = 'Tim';
          contact.lastName = 'Neil';
          
      var args = new blackberry.invoke.AddressBookArguments(contact);
          args.view = blackberry.invoke.AddressBookArguments.VIEW_NEW;

      blackberry.invoke.invoke(blackberry.invoke.APP_ADDRESSBOOK, args);
      
</script>

func.name: invoke
func.comment: Invokes another application on the BlackBerry smartphone.

param.name: appType
param.comment: an integer value representing the type of application to launch. Can be one of the 'APP_*' constants.

param.name: args
param.comment: An arguments object specifying information for the application being invoked.

func.details: Thows an Exception if values supplied are not correct.

test.name: invoke_Exception
test.comment: Exception test for invoke general parameters
